title: Amex Direct Feed Cards Remain Unassigned in New Expensify After Migration

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.3..3-8
**Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Reproduction blocked)
**Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @Leeckhart
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1769520925052579)

## Action Performed:
1. In Classic: Navigate to Settings → Domains → [Domain Name] → [Workspace] → Settings
2. Set and save the workspace as the preferred workspace
3. Same process applied successfully to all other card feeds (e.g., Chase)
4. In New Expensify: Navigate to Workspaces → [Workspace] → Company Cards → American Express Cards (Direct feed)
5. Observe the card list displayed
## Expected Result:
All Amex cards associated with the domain should:
Appear in New Expensify
Be automatically assigned based on existing Classic assignments
Match the behavior of other migrated card feeds
## Actual Result:
Only one Amex card  is assigned and  the remaining 9 Amex cards are unassigned in New Expensify.
## Workaround:
Unknown
## Platforms:
Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [x] Windows: Chrome
- [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

## Screenshots/Videos

The screenshot for the issue is in Slack [thread](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1769520925052579)

[View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** v9.3.10-3
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176927/test-cases/41237626
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** lattelover1412+od2701a@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Regression TC Execution
**Device used:** iphone promax 13, IOS 26.2
**App Component:** Money Requests

## Action Performed:
Preconditions:
1. On Web, sign in with a new account on OldDot (staging.expensify.com)
2. user directed to ND, select option Manage my team 1 -10, then continue with onboarding flow
3. Ensure a workspace is created
4. Switch to old dot then Create a new report
5. Add 3 expenses to the report and don't submit it
6. Open the console and run the following snippet:
`NVP.set('tryNewDot', {classicRedirect: {dismissed: false, timestamp: '2024-01-07'}, nudgeMigration: {timestamp: '2024-01-07'}});`
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Perform on IOS app
1. Launch the app 
2. Sign in with the same account (switch to ND, if you are happen to be on OD)
3. Verify that the "Welcome to New Expensify!" modal is displayed
4. Tap "Lets go"
5. Verify you are redirected to the Reports page
6. Tap on the Expense report 
7. Navigate away then return to the same expense report

## Expected Result:
No loading animation should persist once the report is fully loaded.

## Actual Result:
under The total amount section shows an endless loading spinner.

## Workaround:
Unknown

- [x] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [x] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.3.10-3
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/77948
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+ap3@applause.expensifail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration
**Device used:** Windows 11
**App Component:** Other

## Action Performed:
1.Open a group chat
2.Open a task report
3.Click the report header
4.Select Details
5.Click Delete
6.Confirm deletion

## Expected Result:
User is redirected back to the parent group chat after deleting the task report.

## Actual Result:
User remains on the deleted task report screen after confirming deletion. The task no longer exists but the UI stays on the task view, leaving the user in an invalid report context. Other delete flows redirect correctly, making this behavior inconsistent.

## Workaround:
Unknown

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.3.10.0
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-3693/folder/18717689/49855697/1152506254?q=no+workspace&issue_type=jira
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+2250@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration
**Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 (Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome
**App Component:** Workspace Settings

## Action Performed:
1. Open the Expensify app. 
2. Sign up with a new account. 
3. Complete onboarding modal selecting "Track and budget expenses" and without creating any workspace.
4. Create a manual expense and submit it to Self DM.
5. Open the just created expense.
6. Tap on "Category" field.
7. Tap on "Upgrade" and confirm the workspace creation.
8. Tap on "Got it, thanks"
9. Navigate to "Workspaces" and open the just created workspace.
10. Tap on "Workflows"
11. Enable "Approvals" and "Payments"
12. Return to workspace menu.
13. Note that a RBR appeared on "Account" section.
14. Navigate to "Account"
15. Note that no error is visible on any section of "Account"

## Expected Result:
No RBR or error should appear on "Account" section after enabling "Approvals" and "Payments" on a workspace created via "Upgrade" flow.

## Actual Result:
After enabling "Approvals" and "Payments" on a workspace created via category field "Upgrade" flow, an RBR appears on "Account" section. RBR can´t be dismissed as no error can be found.

## Workaround:
Unknown

- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App

___

**Version Number:** 9.3.10-3
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-3692/folder/13176791/41237175/1152504629
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** jdoijnonjsjsojns@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration
**Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome
**App Component:** Money Requests

## Action Performed:
Precondition:
- Admin invites member to the workspace.

1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com
2. [Member] Open workspace chat.
3. [Member] Create an expense. Do not click Submit on the expense preview.
4. [Admin] Open member's expense report.
5. [Admin] Click More > Split > Save.
6. [Admin] Go to admin's workspace chat.
7. [Admin] Click + > Create expense > Manual.
8. [Admin] Create an expense.
9. [Admin] Go to member's workspace chat.

## Expected Result:
The expense will be created in admin's workspace chat.

## Actual Result:
The expense is created in member's workspace chat after admin splits member's expense and submits expense in own's workspace chat.

## Workaround:
Unknown

**Version Number:** 9.3.10-0
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/80333
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** jsoidjnosdiodsjnosjnois@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration
**Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome
**App Component:** Money Requests

## Action Performed:
1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com
2. Create a new account.
3. Create a workspace.
4. Go to Reports > Top categories.
5. Open FAB > Create expense > Manual.
6. Create a manual expense with date from last month and any category.
7. Expand the category row.
8. Open FAB > Create expense > Manual.
9. Create a manual expense with date from last month and DIFFERENT category.

## Expected Result:
The new category row will expand and show the expense.

## Actual Result:
The new category row expands and does not show the expense.
The same issue happens on Top spenders.

## Workaround:
Unknown

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.3.9-2
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/80604 step 8
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Pull Request QA execution
**Device used:** iPhone 15 iOS 26.2
**App Component:** Money Requests

## Action Performed:
Preconditions: log in with a new expensifail account.
Create Workspace 1 (default), currency USD, distance unit - miles, rates: default $0.725, new rate $1
Create Workspace 2, currency EUR, unit - kilometers, default rate - €0.725, new rate €3

1. Tap FAB > Track Distance > GPS tab
2. Track some distance, tap Stop - Stop GPS tracking - Next
3. Verify that the default expense policy is used for distance unit in Distance and Rate (miles)
4. Tap Rate, select $1/mile rate, then switch back to default rate
5. Tap "To" field and select Workspace 2
6. Observe the Distance and Rate fields - it displays miles instead of kilometers
7. Tap Rates and observe the Default rate - it is shown as  €0.725/mile instead of kilometer

## Expected Result:
The Distance and Rate fields show the correct unit after changing the participant workspace

## Actual Result:
Unit is shown incorrectly in Distance and Rate fields after switching the workspace

## Workaround:
Unknown

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.9-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @PedroEspinoza1999 **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1769216206401249) ## Action Performed: 1. Navigate to Reports > Reports 2. Click on any report to view details 3. Click on the "More" button and observe ## Expected Result: Users can print reports instantly from the report view ## Actual Result: New Expensify currently does not offer a Print button directly within reports. In Expensify Classic, users can print reports immediately using a dedicated Print button, enabling much faster workflows. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Solution: Introduce a Print functionality directly within reports in New Expensify that mirrors the behavior in Expensify Classic. This would allow users to instantly print reports without first downloading files, saving time and improving the overall reporting experience. ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/98eff8b7-7bf7-4a32-b469-10d6ee4b9d98 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.3.9-1
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-3607/folder/13176791/41237172/1149843141
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdosjosjdoijosjosidj@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration
**Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome
**App Component:** Money Requests

## Action Performed:
1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com
2. Go to workspace chat.
3. Create an expense.
4. Open the expense.
5. Click More > Split > Save.
6. Log in to the same account on OD.
7. On OD, open the report with split expenses.
8. On OD, open any split, change the amount to 0 and save it.
9. Return to ND and refresh the same report on ND.
10. Open the non-zero split.
11. Click Amount.
12. Click on the split row with 0.00 amount.

## Expected Result:
User should be able to edit the split when split amount is 0.00.

## Actual Result:
User is not able to edit the split when split amount is 0.00.
It shows "Approved or paid expenses cannot be edited" which is not true because the split is not approved or paid.

## Workaround:
Unknown

## Platforms:
- [x] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [x] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
